title: Chair, 1901
markings: Signed on back of seat with monogram and 1901.
provenance: Museum purchase from Mary Blackwelder Memorial Fund
creditline: Museum purchase from Mary Blackwelder Memorial Fund
description: High-backed side chair; oak frame composed of two posts culminating in octagonal stiles at top; seat back of four curved horizontal elements. Square seat with slit cut in top rear; apron with curved bottom edges incorporating notched. Four legs ending in eight-sided bun feet. Reproduction cushions of dark brown leather with leather lanyards at corners; recthangular back cushion tied to horizontal elements of chair frame; square seat cushion rests on seat, multiple lanyards at each corner hanging to floor.

tombstone.epitaph:
Chair, 1901.
1901. Oak, leather cushions (reproduction). Museum purchase from Mary Blackwelder Memorial Fund. 1976-22-1-a,b.
